actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: Africa Info reported that the President of the Cameroon Natonal Assembly went under heavy guard to the Safari locality near Kolofata, triggering an attempted hostage taking by Boko Haram which evolved into a significant offensive. The elite Rapid Intervention Battalion fought off the Boko Haram fighters. Specific casualties were not reported.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: Boko Haram attacked a number of Cameroonian villages starting on Dec.26 and continuing over the weekend, including: Amchide, Limani, Makari, Chogori, Doble, and Waza. The Cameroonian military opposed them, including the air force of Rapid Intervention Battalion. 41 Boko Haram fighters were killed in total, but they took their worst losses in Chogori at 34 killed. 1 Cameroonian soldier was killed on the Waza-Mora highway and 3 air force pilots were seriously injured.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Attempts by Boko Haram insurgents to capture Damagun was resisted by security forces, leading to a fierce battle that lasted well over two hours. Witnesses said the insurgents threw many explosive devices into Damagun police station and shot sporadically into a military base. No causalities reported.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Bulabulin on 16/12, battles with military forces before being repelled after several days (17/12 - 19/12). An estimated 75 members of Boko Haram killed and two soldiers in the battle. Bulabulin lies near Gumsuri, the cite of a recent mass Boko Haram abduction.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram took over Lassa town in Askira/Uba local government council, Borno State, leaving many persons dead, many places of worship and residential houses burnt down. The attack, according to reports from Lassa, was resisted by the villagers who engaged the attackers with locally made rifles, bows and arrows. Numbers of the fighting dead not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: At least 30 Boko Haram fighters were killed by operatives of the Civilian-JTF (BVYG) when the insurgents attempted to attack Kareto and Gubio villages in Mobbar Local Government Area of Borno State.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram members attack Hong, razing a police station and raising their flag about the home of a military general. Causalities not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram overtakes Pella from military forces. The attack is believed part of a coordinated effort which included Gombe and Hong. Causalities not known. Exact date is not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Nigerian forces recapture Mubi, causing much of the Boko Haram population to flee. Several Boko Haram deaths claimed by residents, though specific number were not provided.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: No fewer than 75 Boko Haram militants were killed and Maiha recaptured by local hunters. Of the dead, 10 may have been civilians Boko Haram executed while fleeing. Maiha had been overrun and captured by Boko Haram just days earlier.

notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen carrying grenade launchers attacked the security services in Nafada. The attack in Gombe state came just after midday and began with a gunfight at a military checkpoint on the outskirts of Nafada town, causalities not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks a prison in Koton Karifi, overpowers security forces and frees 145 inmates. Two deaths reported, both security forces. Several fugitives were recovered by police in the following days.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces and the "Civilian JTF" kill 41 members of Boko Haram in a gun battle in Gur. One members of Boko Haram was captured alive. Following the battle soldiers severed the heads of the deceased Boko Haram combatants.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah
notes: Boko Haram fighters launched a major attack in Adamawa State, capturing the commercial town of Mubi, where they killed many people (later reported as 200 dead over two days) and released inmates from a prison. Many military forces had fled the area prior to the attack, leaving only a few, who were quickly overrun. Causality specifics not known. Boko Haram militants have also hoisted the sects flag and imposed a curfew in Mubi.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: French special forces carried out a raid on a GMA convoy, striking 1 vehicle from the air and killing 3 occupants, then landing special forces and capturing multiple militants, including Abu Asum al-Muhajir, the spokesperson for GMA.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attempts to take over the Kano-Maiduguri highway in Ngamdu, and are dramatically pushed back by military forces who report to have killed 150 or more in the ensuing battle.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Following an extensive battle the previous day, Boko Haram again returns to Konduga (presumably to retrieve their dead) and is engaged into another battle. Sixty reported Boko Haram deaths, military forces wound and kill a notable commander, later revealed to be Abubakar Shekau, though Shekau may have been captured in nearby Benisheikh. A matter of dispute: some believe this may have been a been a body double. It was gathered that when the militants discovered that Konduga was a no go area, they headed to nearby Benisheikh and laid ambush for troops on patrol duties.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces fight through a Boko Haram ambush, capture a senior leader, identity unknown. One soldier was reported dead after the battle.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two Boko Haram commanders and 15 of their fighters are killed in a pair of clashes with military forces in Baaza and Michika.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram again attempts to overtake Konduga. Military forces retaliate, killing an estimated 100. The battle is believed to have lasted over twelve hours.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two Boko Haram commanders and 15 of their fighters are killed in a pair of clashs with military forces in Baaza and Michika.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launches a "massive" attack on Konduga, 35km from Maiduguri, causing a three-hour battle with military forces. Reports indicate Boko Haram suffered heavy causalities before fleeing. Military forces captured several pieces of heavy equipment and weapons from the attackers. Xinhua places the death number of Boko Haram at 100, others place it as high as 120. Later reports suggest the causality total with as high as 250, with four injured military. A air force jet was downed during the operation - the pilot was later captured by Boko Haram, who nearly a month later released a video of his beheading.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launches a "massive" attack on Konduga, 35km from Maiduguri, causing a three-hour battle with military forces. Reports indicate Boko Haram suffered heavy causalities before fleeing. Military forces captured several pieces of heavy equipment and weapons from the attackers. Xinhua places the death number of Boko Haram at 100, others place it as high as 120. Later reports suggest the casuality total with as high as 250, with four injured military. A air force jet was downed during the operation - the fate of the pilot is not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: No fewer than 75 members of Boko Haram have reportedly been killed by local hunters in Michika and Madagali local government areas of Adamawa state. Date(s) unknown.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: No fewer than 75 members of Boko Haram have reportedly been killed by local hunters in Michika and Madagali local government areas of Adamawa state. Date(s) unknown.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Following an assault on Michika by Boko Haram, military forces launch a campaign to liberate the city, which included an air assault. During the battle, one known causality of note was the son of a former politician, all totalling 24. Boko Haram causalities not known - the fighting was reported as "fierce." As a result of the attack, the army has moved sensitive weapons from Mubi. Despite an early report the military had retaken the city, it was later learned Boko Haram maintained control of the area.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: "Fierce" fighting between Boko Haram and military forces in Mubi. "Scores" of [Boko Haram] killed in the fighting, soldiers reported injuries. Exact date is not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Twenty members of Boko Haram are killed (some sources claim 21) in an attempt to overtake Buratai and target a military commander. The attack took place during the morning hours. A school building was also razed.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces launched an attack on Boko Haram in Kawuri, killing 50 of its members. The attack was pre-emptive, as information was gathered that Boko Haram was planning an attack on nearby Konduga. Following the operation soldiers went on patrols in Konduga.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
source: Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale; Associated Press
notes: Cameroonian military sources report that they have killed over 100 Boko Haram fighters during a raid across the border into Fotokol from Gamboru-Ngala, including shelling by Boko Haram fighters. Cameroonian forces responded with "intense gunfire", and with the assistance of mortar fire, pushed Boko Haram forces out of Gamboru-Ngala on the Nigerian side of the border.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack and kill two police at Magama Gumau station in Toro LGA.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram members reportedly took over Bama town - the second largest town in the state - and hoisted the sects flag, following a gun battle between they and Nigerian soldiers. "Scores" killed before soldiers fled the city alongside civilians - thousands displaced. Military sources who spoke to journalists in Maiduguri said the soldiers were able to kill about 70 of the militants and injure about 30 others. Some reports have the death total as high as 130. The number of soldiers and civilians killed are not known. Despite several sources reporting the fall a Bama to Boko Haram, Xinhua and This Day (Lagos) reports the military repelled the attack, the latter describing the battle as Boko Harams "Waterloo." It is possible Boko Haram retreated, regrouped, and attacked again. A military airstrike was involved in the battle.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: The Cameroonian army has reportedly killed 40 Boko Haram insurgents in a battle that lasted three hours after they tried to enter Cameroon through Fotokol.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram captures Dikwa and Marte town, raising their flag above the cities, with "very little resistance from military forces." The initial gunfire caused many of the residences to flee. Casualties not known. The attack occurred during the evening hours.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram captures Dikwa and Marte town, raising their flag above the cities, with "very little resistance from military forces." The initial gunfire caused many of the residences to flee. Casualties not known. The attack occurred during the evening hours.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attack and overtake Dalwa. It appears this was done by the same group and the same operation as the excursion into Jibwhiwhui. Fourteen dead between the two towns.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Cameroonian forces dislodged Boko Haram fighters in the vicinity of the border communities of Keraoua and Ashigashiya after clashes.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Cameroonian forces clashes with Boko Haram fighters near Keraoua.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Heavy fighting was reported in Kolofata. The Cameroonian forces were forced to retreat but allegedly managed to repel Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Fighting was reported around Ashigashiya. The city was said to be partially occupied by Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Cameroonian soldiers repeled an incursion by Boko Haram fighters into Fotokol. 30 Boko Haram fighters were reported killed over the two days of fighting around Fotokol, heavy weapons seized, and at least one vehicle destroyed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
source: Radio France Internationale; Voice of America (Washington, DC); Leadership (Abuja)
notes: Cameroonian troops engaged with Boko Haram militants after they drove the Nigerian military out of Gambaru Ngala. Cameroonian forces also took control of a bridge in Gambaru that marks its border with Nigeria after Boko Haram militants attempted to blow it up. 30 Boko Haram fighters were reported killed over the two days of fighting around Fotokol, heavy weapons seized, and at least one vehicle destroyed.

actor1: MASSOB-Uwazuruike: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra (Uwazuruike Faction)
actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: Two factions of MASSOB clash at a headquarters in Okwe over internal political strife. Four believed dead.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: The Cameroonian military engaged Boko Haram miliants near the Nigerian border for two days; two vehicles transporting Boko Haram militants were destroyed and ammunition and weapons were seized

actor2: BZM: Biafra Zionist Movement
notes: Members of a Biafran separatist movement storm a radio station to declare their independence on air, but are pushed back by police forces. Two police deaths resulted from the clash. 13 BZM arrests .

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
source: Xinhua News - French, Voice of America (Washington, DC)
notes: 40 heavily armed Boko Haram fighters were killed in fierce fighting between the Cameroonian military and Boko Haram fighters after Cameroonian forces ambushed them; at least one vehicle of the Cameroonian security forces was destroyed; some sources quoted 60 Boko Haram fighters being killed

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: During the early morning hours a group of 50 unidentified attackers raid a government house in Enugu, but were repelled by security operatives attached to the state seat of power. One of the invaders was shot dead, three arrested while others escaped. Several machetes were recovered from them. Later, authorities allege MASSOB was responsible for the attack.

actor2: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
notes: MEND attacks, and later claims responsibility, for an attack of a military boat along the Nembe-Bassanbiri waterways in Bayelsa State. Causalities not known.

actor1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Biafra fighters clash with a group of traders over a tax levied by MASSOB. Eleven injuries reported.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Clashes between attackers from CAR and the Cameroonian army in the village of Gbiti. The violence has killed seven people (five attackers, a Cameroonian military official and a civilian) while a dozen prisoners were arrested. Seleka believed to be responsible, although this has not yet been formally announced.

actor2: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
notes: Four persons, including two soldiers and two civilians were killed early in the day along Agip/Saipem area of Port Harcourt by MEND gunmen who were fleeing after a foiled kidnap attempt.

actor1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Four are killed in a clash between MASSOB a joint team of security (unnamed) in Onitsha, Anambra State. There are conflicting accounts as to the reason of the clash.

actor2: Seleka Rebel Coalition
notes: Attack of the border by Seleka elements, one Cameroonian soldier was killed. 2 arrested

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: MASSOB accuses police and vigilante of Omelugboma in Oshimili of killing seven of their members while over 96 others sustained various degrees of injuries arising from bullet wounds during two raids. This event was not confirmed by police forces.

actor1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
actor2: AIYO: Association of Igbo Youth Organisation
notes: One is killed and several others wounded in a clash between MASSOB and an Igbo group. The clash began after MASSOB received complaints that AIYO operatives were using their camps along Onitsha-Owerri road to torture people.

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: A clash between MASSOB and police left a police van burnt and two other vehicles destroyed. Ten injured. The clash was fought over the issue of political autonomy.

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: 11 members of MASSOB, Idemili South Local Government Areas of Anambra State, were shot and injured by the police in a bid to disrupt their June 8 sit-at-home rally. Five others were arrested.

actor2: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
notes: French troops assaulted MUJAO militants in Agadez following yesterdays suicide attacks. 2 killed.

actor2: Seleka Rebel Coalition
notes: Clashes between elements of the Seleka and the Military Forces of Cameroon in the village. Only exchange of shootings

actor2: Seleka Rebel Coalition
notes: Clashes between elements of the Seleka and the Military Forces of Cameroon in the village. Only exchange of shootings

actor2: Seleka Rebel Coalition
notes: Cameroonian troops have clashed with the Seleka rebels of the Central African Republic on the border of the two countries. "There were shots, gunshots, from both sides of the border" between Tuesday and Wednesday, a salesman working in the eastern Cameroonian border-town of Garoua-Boulai said. "People panicked and fled."

actor2: Seleka Rebel Coalition
notes: Military operation to kill elements of CAR military forces who found refuge in Cameroon and regurlarly loot villages and attack the Seleka Coalition

actor1: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: MEND attacks another armed group (likely former members of the sect who in the past had taken part in a government amnesty deal), killing eight. Until recent weeks MEND has been relatively inactive since 2009.

actor2: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
notes: A group of MEND militants shoots and kills 13 police officers at close range along the creek of Azuzuama in Southern Ijaw Local Government Area of Bayelsa state. The group had made threats to kill police in previous days. Some reports have the death total at 15. In the days following the attack both MEND and General Adaka Boro Jnr group claimed responsibility, though it is believed MEND in the sole perpetrator. Authorities arrested several suspects in the following week.

actor2: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Seleka members attacked the town of Kentzou in eastern Cameroon, 10 km from the border with CAR, to free some fellow militants arrested the day before by the authorities. A Cameroonian soldier was held in hostage

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: Members of the Movement for the Actualization of the Sovereign State of Biafra, MASSOB, some suspected Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, and the police clashed in a market square in Izzi Local Government Area of Ebonyi State after a weeks long build up of tensions between the groups is sparked by a misunderstanding. Following the clash members of the police went t to the local MASSOB headquarters, destroyed property and looted office supplies. No report of injury or causality.

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: A gunman attacks a regional leader of MASSOB, but the leader escapes unharmed. It is unclear if this was an assassination attempt or a robbery.

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: Members of the Onitsha Communal Militia attack two members of MASSOB, injuring them. The two were attacked for allegedly preventing them from collecting illegal levies from Onitsha traders.

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: Day two of a MOSSOB raid. One killed on day two.

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: A combined team of the police, army and other security operatives killed about 16 members of the Movement for the Actualization of the Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB) and injured 83 others as they raided the offices of the group in the commercial city of Onitsha, Anambra State. The raid lasted two days.

actor1: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
actor2: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: MEND shoots and kills four soldiers near the Brass-Ogbia waterways of Bayelsa State. MEND later claimed they killed more than ten soldiers.

actor2: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)

actor2: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-)

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: "The armed men who clashed with the Niger army on Sunday 50 miles north of Arlit were Islamist elements of AQIM," the security official told AFP on condition of anonymity. One soldier, one militant killed.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb

actor2: MNJ: Nigerien Movement for Justice
notes: Government claims to have killed 19 MNJ rebels when it intercepted a drug-smuggling convoy. (MNJ claimed that 12 unarmed civilians were killed- not rebels however).

actor1: FARS: Revolutionary Armed Forces of the Sahara
actor2: Military Forces of Niger (1999-2010)
notes: Clashes broke out between Revolutionary Armed Forces of the Sahara and Niger army. During the battle, one of the FARS leaders, Chahayi Barkaye was killed. The army took munitions from FARS and destroyed two of their bases. It is not known how many died.

actor1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
actor2: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Five are killed as members of the MASSOB militia and police clash as the police attempt to halt a public protest of those seeking a succession form Nigeria.

actor1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
actor2: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Two are dead when members of the Movement for the Actualization of the Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB) clash with police in Aba.

actor2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: Two or more are killed as a joint police/military operation to capture the leader of the MASSOB leads to death of those uninvolved.

actor1: FARS: Revolutionary Armed Forces of the Sahara
actor2: Military Forces of Niger (1996-1999)
notes: Military troops clashed with Tuareg rebels (UFRA) and Toubou (FARS rebels) rebels. 27 rebels were killed and one soldier.

actor2: FARS: Revolutionary Armed Forces of the Sahara
notes: The Revolutionary Armed Forces of the Sahara (FARS) attacked a military convoy. They took five people hostage- four were civilians. FARS claimed they killed 13 soldiers in the attack.

actor2: FARS: Revolutionary Armed Forces of the Sahara
notes: A military post in Madama was attacked by members of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of the Sahara (FARS). Five people were wounded. During the attack, a truck hit a mine, killing five people.

actor2: Military Forces of Niger (1996-1999)
notes: The Democratic Front for Renewal claimed that Niger and Chadian forces attacked their compound and left 17 dead. As a result, the FDR is withdrawing from the 1995 peace agreements.

actor2: Military Forces of Niger (1996-1999)
notes: Fighting broke out between the Democratic Front for Renewal (FDR) (Toubou rebels) and Niger military forces. Casualties were reported on both sides but not the number of casualties.

actor2: RUF: Revolutionary United Front
notes: Government forces gain territory from RUF in Lagos State.
